website_summaries.verdict: Decent price point for an external SSD that includes all of the features that you'll need to keep your data safe.
pros: Will give you slightly above average transfer speeds of 515 Mbps
Delivers both password protection and the option of encrypting your data
Can set it up to perform automatic backups of your data
Ships with a USB cable, so it's ready to use immediately
cons: Doesn't offer a storage capacity size beyond 1 TB
Seems to run much hotter than other SSDs

website_summaries.verdict: The My Passport SSD is an excellent portable drive for those needing to securely carry data on the go.
pros: The My Passport SSD is rugged, light and super compact
The drive uses USB 3.1 Gen 2 Type-C to deliver fast performance
It works with both Windows and MacOS right out of the box and features strong encryption to protect data in case of loss or theft
cons: The drive's capacity caps at just 1TB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent as an external drive for Steam library
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as an external drive for my Steam library, and all my games have run smoothly with no noticeable change in load times. The drive comes with a USB-C cable, along with an adapter that allows it to be used on USB 3.1, 3.0, or 2.0 if needed. I used it with the adapter for my MacBook Air mid-2013's USB 3.0 port, and ran into no problems whatsoever. Definitely recommend this if you're looking for a very portable and speedy solution for external storage.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tong

customer_reviews.title: Fast, light, but gets REALLY hot
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so the speed is great. I love how portable this is. My only concern is that it gets scalding hot (not just warm). This has happened when backing up my laptop, and also when first encrypting it. Really hope this doesn't fry within a year.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Best portable SSD for the price.
customer_reviews.text: WD has put out an excellent product here. I installed Steam and about 400GB of games so I can play my games on my laptop when I am traveling. So far I am having zero issues. This is the best portable SSD for your money right now. It also comes with an attachment for the cord that lets you plug into a standard USB 2.0-3.0 and that snaps off to let you plug into the USB 3.1 SSD slot, it saves me some USB space. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after longer sessions..
customer_reviews.text: Using this to connect to my Xbox One X to improve loading performance. Worked really well for about a month, but then began to stop working in the middle of games (usually after longer sessions of over 2 hours) which freezes the game being played. Dont know if this is a memory issue, or an overheating issue (doesnt feel hot), but when it is unplugged, and plugged back in, it works again immediately for another hour or so before needing this again. Not fun to have to deal with :/
customer_reviews.author: Shalilynn Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for Xbox One X external drive
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this drive with my Xbox One X, storing my most played games on it, and it works great. I’ve noticed significantly faster load times.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far
customer_reviews.text: Working great so far, also was smaller than I expected. I'm using this on an Xbox One X at the moment and it definitely causes offline games to load faster on top of the already increased rate from the new console. I tested it by looking at load times for Fallout 4 when it was on the internal hard drive vs load times when it was on WD SSD.
customer_reviews.author: B-Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Died after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: No stars for this drive. It died after using it about 2 weeks. Lost all my data. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Juliet Hill

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not that great, especially for the price, small and light, WD Software is junk, consider saving money - I should hav
customer_reviews.text: Nothing too grand here - it is transferring at 300 MB/s on my USB Type C connection via Dell Docking station (also hooked up with the Type C). I only have the one Type C plug on .... well my laptop and my pc.... WD Software is junk - and tries three separate times at least to get you to share your information. Also caused my virus scanner to trip on it suggesting it was malware. Immediately wipe the software from the drive to free up a touch of space is my recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 7 Months - Catastrophic Failure Loss of Backup Data
customer_reviews.text: Loved it while it worked. Fast backups. Easy to use. Purchase September 2, 2018. Died April 20, 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Check It Out

customer_reviews.title: No trim!
customer_reviews.text: Decent 350M/s Rd, 250 write falling to 100M/s on USB3.0. Gets hot: vertical: 128°F in spots after heavy use. Major limitation: No trim on Linux 5! Without trim, write speeds drop due to write amplification! Good thing I formatted it to 450G leaving 60Gb free space before testing or it would be worse. Since it was on sale it is still a good value. No way I will pay full price for this.
customer_reviews.author: codercharles

customer_reviews.title: Small, Light, Great Capacity, Solid State Reliability
customer_reviews.text: The WD My Passport SSD is a very versatile and capable storage device. Light and small enough to tether to a computer or monitor with velcro, good capacity versus cost, and the reliability of solid state operation make the WD SSD a great choice. For some applications, the unit needs to be reformatted to NTFS to hold very large file sizes, but in general the existing format works for most users.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas CoffeyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great little piece of technology!
customer_reviews.text: Has been working perfectly since original install --- lightning fast - no hesitation and immediate response. So much faster than an external hard drive! Unit gets slightly (very slightly) warm but, again, nothing like an external drive unit. A definite recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G. Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for composers of video game soundtracks
customer_reviews.text: I use this SSD through my USB 3.0 port to stream my sound libraries into Logic Pro X and it's phenomenal. BUT, in order for it to be quick for your sound library, you have to go to Disk Utility and press erase on the drive where it will give you the option to reformat it to "Mac OS Extended (Journaled)" BE SURE YOU REFORMAT IT FOR SAMPLES otherwise they'll be even slower than before you had the drive!
customer_reviews.author: Eric | Orchestorm

customer_reviews.title: Not for Macs!!!
customer_reviews.text: Spent 4 hours trying to make it work for my iMac. Returned it and purchased another "WD My Passport for Mac" and it works perfectly right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: WD Solid State Drive
customer_reviews.text: Is was recommended my PC Magazine as one of their top five SSD external drives of 2020. And I can see why. 511 gigabytes of useable ROM, and it's fast. It is dimensionally 3&1/2" long, 1&3/4" wide, and 5/8" tall. So, the portability factor is no problem. I am currently using it as my primary drive, and it has not failed to impress me. I would recommend this external Western Digital Solid State Drive to anyone looking for a replacement for their clunky old HHD, or just for the unplug and go flexibility it offers. Five Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: So convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when it was twice the price it is now, but I still think it was worth the full cost. I put a bootloader with over 30 live boot os's and installation discs as well as ~1000 small softwares and tools. I use this on PC's as old as 2003 up to the newest ones. IT work is a breeze now.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Justus Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Great for Mac and Adobe
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in support of Adobe CC software. The solid state drive acts as a fast secondary system drive. I configured this to be the adobe cache/media cache and plugin drive.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good harddisk
customer_reviews.text: Was actually looking for a 1TB size external disk, but could not resist this offer. A good price for an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but problems!
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy this item!! I purchased one to back up my coding work and everytime I open it in finder its empty. I have to eject the drive and reconnect to see the folders and files that I have installed within. Also, I can't rename the drive without receiving an error so it will forever be called My Passport.
customer_reviews.author: Craig D Tiefenbrun

customer_reviews.title: Sexy design. Perfect operation.
customer_reviews.text: Life saver. Great product at a great price. This guy is tiny and well built. Second one I purchased. I have the 500G and 1T units. Excellent time saving, fast and well built, fits in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Not for use as a backup drive, or anything else for that matter.
customer_reviews.text: The drives failed to perform any kind of backup of my Windows 10 PC. The WD software froze every single time I attempted a backup. I do not recommend this product. Also manual transfer of files were slow for what's considered an SSD. Do yourself a favor and if you want a backup just get yourself a Samsung 970 Pro M.2 SSD instead if you've got the extra port/slot - same price and the performance by far beats this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to image an internal 1 Tb SSD on my iMac. Absolutely love it. I can mirror the iMac internal drive in minimum time since I'm going SSD to SSD. Plug and play through the USB-C port. I've always been a WD fan, and this one has kept me a satisfied customer for sure.
customer_reviews.author: NC Railroader

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Fast transfers and large amount of storage
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. Fast transfers and large amount of storage. Charger also works crazy fast with my S8 phone which saves my outlet space.
customer_reviews.author: doc

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great transfer speeds and the USB C to type A adapter stays on well
customer_reviews.author: A. Kibria

customer_reviews.title: Very easy!
customer_reviews.text: It took me longer to unpack this SSD than to set it up. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Moore

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance, build quality seems very good so far. I can't believe how small and light this thing is.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo A.

customer_reviews.title: Use it as a SSD for Mac Sierra. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Use it as a SSD for Mac Sierra. I circumvented the greedy apple company for not putting ssd's in their new iMacs. I mean why?
customer_reviews.author: Patty Bonarrigo

customer_reviews.title: It is not plug and use as my previous drives ...
customer_reviews.text: It is not plug and use as my previous drives. Crashed my macbook air 5 times during a packed club while I was mixing music.
customer_reviews.author: illbot

customer_reviews.title: Works for DVR. Warm. Good speed, no latency.
customer_reviews.text: Gets warm to touch. I have it connected to an Nvidia Shield to DVR cable shows streamed via HDHomeRun Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Polutta

customer_reviews.title: 256gb works with og xbox one
customer_reviews.text: using the 256gb on an OG xbox one works great. load times were cut down 30 seconds or more with some games. super small and thin, does get a little warm after it has been on and working for a while but I guess that is fine.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: Super small, fast, and portable
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is such an incredible little drive. And I do stress little, check out the dimensions again, it is tiny! Super portable, very fast, and great design. Definitely recommend getting a case for it, because it is so small.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M Halloran

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly for my Xbox one x and helps pubg and other games render a little more quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect it to fail if it gets dropped.
customer_reviews.text: Great drive for a small, lightly used travel laptop ... good place to put file history and backup ofr miscellaneous files.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: fast
customer_reviews.text: amazingly fast. stylish. easy to use. great for weekly backups.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great for Xbox
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up to my xbox and it allows me to run my games faster. I only put my most used games on it.
customer_reviews.author: K and J Isaacson

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than you think, great product.
customer_reviews.text: I love how small this thing is yet able to fit a large amount of data. Works perfectly for me, though it does get a bit warm at times.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My games on xbox one load up a lot faster and improved the gameplay!
customer_reviews.author: Ivan C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for backing up & saving things that are important ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for backing up & saving things that are important to you. I use it mostly for Pictures and music and my financal things.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Lite weight, small size, fast down load. I use it for automatic backup and to store photos and others large files
customer_reviews.author: JFW

customer_reviews.title: Super quick.
customer_reviews.text: It was shipped quickly. I've been using the HD on a daily basis. Super quick.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works nice. Got it to write at 250 MB/s through my older USB 3.0 port.
customer_reviews.author: D.V.

customer_reviews.title: YES
customer_reviews.text: Don't usually post reviews but GUYS. Got this baby to edit and store files from Final Cut Pro, etc. and it is. so. fast. Great product for price, you won't forget it. Also weighs almost nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Stray

customer_reviews.title: The storage is perfect both in weight and size
customer_reviews.text: The storage is perfect both in weight and size. It comes with security software which makes it perfect. It uses the metallic structure as a heat sink, in other words very well thought out. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Torrejon Toro

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up on a Mac running High Sierra
customer_reviews.text: Small, light,very fast data transfers. Easy to set up on a Mac running High Sierra. Western Digital software installed OK and works. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: James Hickerson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: So far, it does as it says and stores data. The only thing you may need when buying this is a longer cord.
customer_reviews.author: Clone394

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It is working pretty good and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo F. Salazar Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Fast portable Drive
customer_reviews.text: Based on 1.5 months - I have 256GB laptop system image on the disk - rest is used for movie viewing/storage 512GB Fast -runs warm not hot - reformatted to NTFS no problem. I did not opt to use WD's backup utilities. I found supplied C-C cable length good for laptops. Do get a quality cable if you go longer.
customer_reviews.author: Zuludigital

customer_reviews.title: It’s very thin and not weigh nothing
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for work and I’m very impressed with the quality and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eran Bechor

customer_reviews.title: Durable, fast
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in May2018. It's small and working fast. Included short Type-C cable is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: DSoft

customer_reviews.title: Great data storage for the price
customer_reviews.text: Best: fast read/write No real downside except it gets a little warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the drive itself
customer_reviews.text: Love the drive itself, however the software that comes with it is crap. I couldn't get the backup software to work after trying numerous times over 4 hours. Finally just used windows backup. If you just want to drag and drop files it works well too.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: I really like the lock option of wd to protect my info
customer_reviews.author: Matias

customer_reviews.title: aesthetic is nice. ONly comment
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, very fast, aesthetic is nice. ONly comment, as with all portable SSD storage whether it be 236K or 1TB, it runs really hot. I'm afraid to test it for long periods of time should the thing burn out. I use it to backup, but also as an extension of my Macbook storage. Perhaps it's nothing, but the heat of the drive worries me.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Portable S.S.D. For The $$$
customer_reviews.text: Great Little Portable Drive, Roughly About a 1/4 Size Of My Western Digital My Passport 1tb Mechanical Hard Drive. I Have a DELL 15.6" Intel Laptop From 2012 and a ACER 15.6" Laptop From 2014 and I Use This Solid State Drive With Both Laptops. Since It's Fairly New Technology I Felt That The Price/Storage Ratio Was Best Deal With The 512gb Sized Solid State Drive. Obviously The Later You Wait And Hold Off Purchasing One The Prices Will Surely Come Down. But Until Then This 512gb Model Is Fine Enough Right Now For My Needs...
customer_reviews.author: Timothy N.

customer_reviews.title: The Best for Devs
customer_reviews.text: An amazing product, really fast and easy to use. I use it to store VM and all were fine
customer_reviews.author: Jordano

customer_reviews.title: Super fast
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Cannot beat the speed of SSD. I use it for work. I used a program to copy a computer totaling 60Gb and it anly took 14 minutes. Would likley be faster just transfering files
customer_reviews.author: killem

customer_reviews.title: Great transfer speeds and comes with an adapter to switch ...
customer_reviews.text: This portable ssd is everything I need for on the go and extra storage for my MacBook Pro. Great transfer speeds and comes with an adapter to switch between 3.0 and 3.1 usb. Only flaw I don’t like is that it shows finger prints. But this doesn’t affect the product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon S.

customer_reviews.title: One of my favourite purchases!
customer_reviews.text: It does everything the marketing brochure says it does and works to my expectations. Quick file transfers and back ups on the go. Just what I wanted for my constant work travels. I set it to back up files and folders only for work and it does exactly what I want as per the schedule set and it's seemlessly as it's so quick. Very happy for the premium price paid
customer_reviews.author: Joshie

customer_reviews.title: Great small SSD for file transfer and storage
customer_reviews.text: Nice SSD for my new laptop, works great, very fast for file transfer from Laptop to Desktop, even store Utils and Games, and don't worry about a hard drive fail when needed. A++++++++++Seller
customer_reviews.author: R CISLER

customer_reviews.title: runs very hot
customer_reviews.text: gets very hot , but this may be most external ssd , not sure
customer_reviews.author: Sa5150

customer_reviews.title: looks sturdier in the pictures
customer_reviews.text: it looks much better in the pictures, the drive is super light, but feels kind of cheap. the 'metal' part is like a very thin allow or something that will hold finger prints and look dirty. Other than the aesthetics everything works as supposed, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: emiliano

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital has done a great job improving the performance on the My Passport line ...
customer_reviews.text: Western Digital has done a great job improving the performance on the My Passport line as well as improve its aesthetic. This drive performs well on my 2017 MacBook Pro with USB-C.
customer_reviews.author: Theophilus

customer_reviews.title: It's fast and it works. I don't use the software that is included.
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. It comes with some kind of backup software. I just ignored them and deleted them and just format the drive to eXFAT. No issues. I saw that most of the bad reviews involve around the software used and that it bricks the SSD. I don't bother with that and just use it as if it's a regular pin drive.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Received today. Returning tomorrow.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 512GB SSD to backup my 512GB MacBook Pro via Time Machine. Arrived today. Not sure if I got a bum drive or what the deal is here, but it is painfully slow. As in, my WiFi can download data faster than this thing appears to be transferring files slow. Actually, it MUST be a bad unit. My WiFi back up to Time Capsule is faster than this thing connected to my laptop. Will review a replacement unit and consider revising score at that point.
customer_reviews.author: TakeTheFire

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good product, will be using for first time on upcoming trip
customer_reviews.author: William H. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish looking Small size easy for carry Not compatible with some Android Media
customer_reviews.text: Stylish looking Small size easy for carry Not compatible with some Android Media box
customer_reviews.author: HCP.AR

customer_reviews.title: the SSD itself is OK,
customer_reviews.text: the SSD itself is OK, but the included cable feels cheap and sometimes gets disconnected if it moved (idk if it cable related or SSD related issue)
customer_reviews.author: abdulrahman

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Brick.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged item in and attempted to reformat in Mac Os Extended Journaled format (standard procedure). Drive unmounted itself and malfunctioned. Drive can not remount and rendered itself useless.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Packard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and use. Very good software design. Perfect solution for large storage needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: the silver finish can be scratched easily.
customer_reviews.text: pro: light weight con: It's not solid, the cable connection opening is not attaching the exterior shell (it's only connecting the circuit board inside), that means it's not strong enough. I hear little sounds when I plug the cable in and put it out, that's scary. And it looks too plastic, the silver finish can be scratched easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried to reformat the SSD drive for my Mac based ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried to reformat the SSD drive for my Mac based on Western digital instructions. This rendered the drive non-readable and worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Denis P. Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for mac
customer_reviews.text: Spent over 350 bucks on something that doesn't work. I have a mac, followed the instructions to make it compatible and it won't work. I tried several times for the last three months. Of course its too late to return now.
customer_reviews.author: R.

product_meta.title: WD 512GB My Passport SSD Portable Storage - USB 3.1 - Black-Gray - WDBK3E5120PSL-WESN
product_meta.description: Capacity:512GBThe My Passport SSD is portable storage with blazing-fast transfers. Password protection with hardware encryption helps keep your content secure. Easy to use, the My Passport SSD is shock-resistant, compact storage in a cool, durable design.
feature_bullets: Blazing-fast file transfers with speeds up to 515 MB/s
USB Type-C and USB 3.1 Gen 2 ready; USB 3.0, USB 2.0 and USB-A compatible
Trusted Drive built with WD reliability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars463 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
